section.heading: Investigative authority.

para.text: An employer shall develop, maintain, and make available to the Mayor records regarding the employer's activities related to this subchapter that the Mayor may prescribe by rule.
To ensure compliance with the provisions of this subchapter, the Mayor, consistent with constitutional guidelines, may:
Investigate and gather data regarding any wage, hour, condition, or practice of employment related to this subchapter; and
Enter or inspect any place of employment or record required by this subchapter after written notice has been given.
For the purpose of any investigation provided for in this section, the Mayor may exercise the subpoena authority provided in § 1-301.21.

section.codify:annotation: Applicability of D.C. Law 21-264: § 301 of D.C. Law 21-264 provided that the creation of this section by § 111 of D.C. Law 21-264 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
Section 7034 of D.C. Law 22-33 repealed § 301 of D.C. Law 21-264. Therefore the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 21-264 have been given effect.
